posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.46.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • The new “Data usage” feature in Signal settings makes it easy to choose whether or not to automatically download photos, videos, audio files, or other documents. If Signal stops automatically downloading the latest tracks from your friend’s boyfriend’s band in the group chat, you can save your taste in music along with some free space on your hard drive.

  • Now when you attempt to start a chat with someone’s Signal username, it will work even if you accidentally type the “@” symbol first. Some h@bits @re h@rd to bre@k.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.45.0-beta.1…v7.46.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

New Version: 7.46.0-beta.1

55 new commits since 7.45.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.46.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Use --frozen-lockfile in reproducible builds [2]

  • Support dynamic import with preload cache [3]

  • Fix linux CI in main [4]

  • Init Fun Picker [5]

  • Add emoji spritesheets to built app [6]

  • Update apt in CI if install fails [7]

  • Fix thumbnail when forwarding visual media [8]

  • Retry SQL query on successful FTS5 recovery [9]

  • Add mock test for libsignal websockets [10]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.0 [11]

  • Fix missing media icon while sending gifs [12]

  • Don't allow device naming when linking without syncing [13]

  • Require X-Signal-Timestamp header on all storage/group server 403 responses [14]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.1 [15]

  • Improve Processing of Sync Tasks [16]

  • More accurate startup/backups benchmarks [17]

  • Improve recovery from corrupted downloads [18]

  • Fix startup benchmark metrics [19]

  • Improve handling of edited long message attachments [20]

  • Cache ~/.electron-gyp in CI [21]

  • Set MAX_CYCLES=2 for benchmarks in main [22]

  • Refresh self conversation verified state on registration [23]

  • Prioritize sticker downloads initiated from UI [24]

  • Upgrade libsignal to 0.67.0 [25]

  • Remove libsignal shadowing modes [26]

  • Use new connect logic for libsignal CDSI with flag [27]

  • Use ms-winsoundevent:Notification.IM on Windows [28]

  • Fix flaky test [29]

  • Bump libsignal-client to 0.67.1 [30]

  • Release notes for 7.45 [31]

  • Update strings [32]

  • Update DNS fallback [33]

  • Show a modal for macOS media permissions [34]

  • Show update UI on asar changes on Linux [35]

  • Fix media permissions modal string [36]

  • Reuse webp emoji sheets in the app [37]

  • Avoid spurious error log when waiting for contact syncs [38]

  • Stories: Be resilient to a missing conversation [39]

  • Revert "Bump libsignal-client to 0.67.1" [40]

  • Fix zoom on macOS and when restoring window [41]

  • Show speaking indicator in 1:1 calls [42]

  • Calling/handleOutgoingSignaling: Wait for job completion or timeout [43]

  • Move react-dev-tools-core to dev dependencies [44]

  • Exclude bundled dependencies from asar [45]

  • Allow leading @ in Compose/Find by username [46]

  • New option: Disable automatic attachment downloads [47]

  • Fix resumable attachment downloads [48]

  • Compactify locales even more [49]

  • Fix linking QR code for windows high contrast mode [50]

  • sendNormalMessage: If no errors, still retry messages send if needed [51]

  • Show critical-idle-primary-device banner in response to WS upgrade response headers [52]

  • Release notes for 7.46 [53]

  • Update strings [54]

  • 7.46.0-beta.1 [55]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.45.0-beta.1…v7.46.0-beta.1

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.45 release

posts.cooked:
My application changes to a language that is not the system language, maybe the keyboard, second system or region language I assume. So it is not a random language.

Ah I now see this was reported in 7.45 beta as well, hadn’t opened it in a while.

debug log

I muted a conversation (one day duration) on desktop. This didn’t cause the conversation to be muted on Android, contrary to expectations.

I think it’s because I closed desktop too fast. But I reopened it a bit after, and the status was still not in sync. I didn’t close desktop aggressively (e.g. no kill -9), just closed it normally.

I’d expect desktop to properly send the change of notification status before closing, or at least remember that it was not properly sent, and send it again next time it’s started, to avoid notification inconsistencies between Android and desktop.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.46.0-beta.1/41b71d939fc82075fb1b2054307f7725f7df35b7068bc0bce9800f95a998e034.gz
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.37.2/148b89eb1c43be749ef9e85bff98dc1434b6ad0c777f87a0d0395056c714137b

Still super slow. I have to work now (with Signal). Waiting since 5 minutes for it to start up. I might delete the .config/Signal again for it to start up faster. But I don’t want to do that every time. Annoying. It wasn’t like that before.

I will try to not forget to send you a debug log in the future. But now I need Signal to work. So I will close it, delete .config/Signal and resync it. Therefore it makes no sense to send a debug log.

I had tried it with the Flatpak and now with the RPM from Opensuse build service. Both the same.

posts.name: Yash Aggarwal
posts.cooked: thank you for the report! Can you also send the debug log from your Android device? EDIT: never mind, I just whiffed the Android debug log link, sorry about that!
